sentence.Network_en: He lay beside her awkwardly, propped on an elbow.
sentence.Network_cn: 他用一只胳膊肘支着身体，别扭地躺在她旁边。

sentence.Network_en: The autoexposure button is awkwardly placed under the lens release button.
sentence.Network_cn: 自动曝光按钮安装在镜头脱卸按钮下面，十分不便。

sentence.Network_en: "This is Malcolm," the girl said awkwardly, to fill the silence.
sentence.Network_cn: 女孩尴尬地说了句“这是马尔科姆”，打破了沉默。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 新编大学英语单词表(第二册) - 豆丁网 ... attendant n. 服务员 awkwardly ad. 笨拙地 container n. 容器.
2011年郑景婷考研英语高频词汇_百度文库 ... aware 意识到；知道 awkwardly 尴尬地 baby boom 婴儿潮.

list.abs: Being different , sometimes awkwardly so , comes naturally to Newfoundlanders ., 与众不同 , 有时很别扭 , 纽芬兰人天生如此.
this essay reads a little awkwardly ., 这篇文章读起来有点别扭.
Attired in new Italian clothes , I awkwardly faced the rather large , paying audience without slides ., 意大利身着新衣服 , 我笨拙地面对相当大 , 没有幻灯片支付观众.

when Rice officials read applications , they look for " diverse life experiences " and what they awkwardly call " overcome students , " who have triumphed over hardship .当莱斯的官员阅读申请书的时候，他们寻找的是“不同的生活体验”以及被他们笨拙地称为“克困学生”的那些成功克服困难的学生。

entry.tran: 使人尴尬的；难处理的；棘手的
entry.def: An awkward situation is embarrassing and difficult to deal with.

example.ex: I was the first to ask him awkward questions but there'll be harder ones to come...
example.tran: 我是第一个向他提出尴尬问题的人，不过还会有人问更难回答的问题。

example.ex: There was an awkward moment as couples decided whether to stand next to their partners.
example.tran: 大家在决定是否要站到自己配偶身旁时，这一刻令人尴尬。

entry.tran: 难使用的；难携带的；（工作）难处理的
entry.def: Something that is awkward to use or carry is difficult to use or carry because of its design. A job that is awkward is difficult to do.

example.ex: It was small but heavy enough to make it awkward to carry...
example.tran: 它虽然小，但很重，不便携带。

example.ex: Full-size tripods can be awkward, especially if you're shooting a low-level subject.
example.tran: 标准尺寸的三脚架可能会不便于使用，用于拍摄低角度的物体时尤其如此。

entry.def: An awkward movement or position is uncomfortable or clumsy.

example.ex: Amy made an awkward gesture with her hands.
example.tran: 埃米笨拙地做了个手势。

entry.tran: 害羞的；尴尬的；局促不安的
entry.def: Someone who feels awkward behaves in a shy or embarrassed way.

example.ex: Women frequently say that they feel awkward taking the initiative in sex...
example.tran: 女人们经常说她们不好意思在性生活上采取主动。

example.ex: He was rather awkward with his godson.
example.tran: 在教子面前，他非常局促不安。

entry.tran: 不可理喻的；难打交道的；难相处的
entry.def: If you say that someone is awkward, you are critical of them because you find them unreasonable and difficult to live with or deal with.

example.ex: She's got to an age where she is being awkward.

auth_sentence.content: Carlos nods awkwardly, unsure of how to respond.
auth_sentence.res_content: Carlos nods awkwardly, unsure of how to respond.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Carlos nods awkwardly, unsure of how to respond.

auth_sentence.content: The Waves, whose poetic prose now reads...awkwardly.
auth_sentence.res_content: The Waves, whose poetic prose now reads...awkwardly.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The Waves, whose poetic prose now reads...awkwardly.

auth_sentence.content: Sometimes, just sitting awkwardly can cause sciatica.
auth_sentence.res_content: Sometimes, just sitting awkwardly can cause sciatica.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Sometimes, just sitting awkwardly can cause sciatica.

sentences.en: He scrambled awkwardly to his feet.
I landed awkwardly and twisted my ankle.
sentences.cn: 我笨拙地跌在地上，扭伤了脚踝。
西蒙笨拙地拖着脚朝他们走去。

sentences.en: I had been lying awkwardly and my leg had gone numb.
sentences.cn: 我一直以一种不舒服的姿势躺着,腿已经麻木了。

sentences.en: He stood awkwardly in the doorway, not sure what to say.
sentences.cn: 他尴尬地站在门口，不知道该说什么。
